chapter.title: Getting started with RestComm
chapter.para: In this chapter we will build RestComm from source code, deploy it to the Mobicents Sip Servlet Container and run the demo application.

section.title: Using the binary distribution
section.para: The easiest way to get started with RestComm is to download and deploy the binary distribution which includes Mobicents Sip Servlet Container + Mobicents Media Server + RestComm to your local machine. In the next few steps we will attempt to do just that and we will start by downloading the binary distribution that uses the JBoss AS and unzipping it to the working directory.
That's it! Now in order to execute the infamous "Hello World" example we have to start the Mobicents Sip Servlet Container and the Mobicents Media Server.
After that open up your favorite softphone and call sip:1234@127.0.0.1:5080
Congratulations you have just executed your first RestComm Application!

section.title: Building from source code
section.para: In this section we will download and build RestComm from the Git repository.
section.screen: ~]$ git clone https://code.google.com/p/restcomm/ ~]$ cd restcomm ~]$ mvn package
section.para: The WAR file restcomm.war will be located in the target folder.

formalpara.title: Deploying RestComm
formalpara.para: To deploy RestComm make sure to start the Mobicents Sip Servlet Container and the Mobicents Media Server. Then copy the restcomm.war file to the deployment directory which is usually located at PARENT_FOLDER/mss-1.6.0/server/default/deploy/. Finally, open up your favorite softphone and call sip:1234@127.0.0.1:5080
